comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another cyclist in NYC to race round Madison Square Garden. See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2449487564/ which has a link to an NYT article that lists the teams.

comment.author: 71222237@N00
comment._content: library: did the bain folks paint onto the glass negative, is the glass itself damaged or did a scanning error produce the strangely blown-out parts on this gentleman's face?

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
memos to the future:

Good question!  An inspection of the original glass negative reveals there is corrosion or similar damage (not silvering) in the negative emulsion on that region of the face, causing the emulsion to appear darker there, and therefore extra white in the scan.  So, it does appear the scan is a faithful reproduction of a slightly damaged glass negative.

comment.author: 71222237@N00
comment._content: thank you for that explanation. very interesting, as we usually don't get to see these kinds of images.

comment._content: I've a ladies Queen of Scots mixte bike with Oscar Egg lugs on the seat tube.
